Lieutenant '''Robert Quilter Gilson''' ([[25 October]] [[1893]] - [[1 July]] [[1916]]) was a childhood friend of [[J.R.R. Tolkien]]. Gilson, Tolkien and [[Geoffrey Bache Smith]] attended [[King Edward's School]] in [[Birmingham]] together, and served in the [[World War I|First World War]]. He was killed by a shell on the first day of the [[Battle of the Somme]].<ref>[[John Garth]], ''[[Tolkien and the Great War]]''</ref>

Actor [[Patrick Gibson]] plays him in biographical drama film about J.R.R. Tolkien, called [[Tolkien (film)|Tolkien]].
